TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ContextMenuEventArgs extends System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the context menu event.
Gets the horizontal position of the mouse.
Docs.value: The horizontal position of the mouse.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the user opens a context menu by right clicking the mouse, this property returns the position of the mouse. Specifying the position of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu> by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.PlacementTarget%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.PlacementRectangle%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.Placement%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.HorizontalOffset%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.VerticalOffsetProperty> properties does not affect the value of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuEventArgs.CursorLeft%2A>.
When the user opens a context menu by using the keyboard, or when the context menu closes, the value of this property is -1.

Docs.summary: Gets the vertical position of the mouse.
Docs.value: The vertical position of the mouse.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the user opens a context menu by right clicking the mouse, this property returns the position of the mouse. Specifying the position of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu> by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.PlacementTarget%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.PlacementRectangle%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.Placement%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.HorizontalOffset%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu.VerticalOffsetProperty> properties does not affect the value of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenuEventArgs.CursorTop%2A>.
When the user opens a context menu by using the keyboard, or when the context menu closes, the value of this property is -1.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void InvokeEventHandler (Delegate genericHandler, object genericTarget);
